message: I'm beginning to look at Foreskin's Lament through the Dramatica lens. I think that Auslander is the Main Character. I suspect that his newly born son is the protagonist, but am not certain. I think that his newborn son may be the protagonist because everything Auslander remembers in the memoir is because he doesn't know whether or not he is going to have his son circumcised.
Are the chapters arranged to tell a story? Or are they just a bunch of independent recollections?

The chapters are arranged to tell a story but contain many flashbacks. Fortunately the flashbacks are emotionally connected and relevant to the story so they make sense, but unfortunately it's sometimes difficult to tell when a flashback occurs.

No, and he is less than 8 days old. I think that my starting this conversation is a bit premature... I'm going to take a few days to plug this into Dramatica (maybe a bit longer depending on my progress with the Shardik project). Thanks.
Is the son actually pursuing a goal? I'm assuming he's less than 8 days old for most of the book. Pre-briss and all.
